catalog_info.title: Systems Programming and Machine Organization
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: CS50 or some experience programming in C.
catalog_info.description: Fundamentals of computer systems programming, machine organization, and performance tuning. This course provides a solid background in systems programming and a deep understanding of low-level machine organization and design. Topics include C and assembly language programming, program optimization, memory hierarchy and caching, virtual memory and dynamic memory management, concurrency, threads, and synchronization.
